formattedAddress: 1567 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10029, USA
adrFormatAddress: 1567 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10029, USA

editorialSummary.text: Funky hub for American eats with espresso & tea drinks, smoothies, shakes, juices, beer & wine.

originalText.text: This diner can take you out of NYC as soon as you walk in the door. Delicious food, excellent vibes. I came with my mother and she was enthralled by the music and decor. The food was great and the staff was polite. I’d recommend this place to anyone!

text.text: This diner can take you out of NYC as soon as you walk in the door. Delicious food, excellent vibes. I came with my mother and she was enthralled by the music and decor. The food was great and the staff was polite. I’d recommend this place to anyone!

originalText.text:
I enjoyed my veggie omelet a lot. It came with spinach, kale, onion, tomato, olive, and avocado with an option of two sides. My two sides were home fries and boguette (Italian bread).

My issue was after I asked the lady at the register to clean the table I chose to sit at. The chick pointed all the other tables. "I could sit at." Well, I stood there waiting for to clean it, and she did. At first, I thought she was having a bad day. But then I came back two weeks later, and the Asian women at the register were still acting nasty towards me. This week, the Asian women placed my water on the other side of the table, where no one was sitting. However, I noticed she was more pleasant to the Caucasian women sitting next to me.

Oh, and they also have a bunch of flies flying around. So pack your patience, bug spray, and a cocktail.

My issue was after I asked the lady at the register to clean the table I chose to sit at. The chick pointed all the other tables. "I could sit at." Well, I stood there waiting for to clean it, and she did. At first, I thought she was having a bad day. But then I came back two weeks later, and the Asian women at the register were still acting nasty towards me. This week, the Asian women placed my water on the other side of the table, where no one was sitting. However, I noticed she was more pleasant to the Caucasian women sitting next to me.

Oh, and they also have a bunch of flies flying around. So pack your patience, bug spray, and a cocktail.

originalText.text: This place is a hidden gem on 100th street and Lexington Avenue on the Upper East side of manhattan. It’s beautifully decorated, there is a bathroom which is always nice to have in Manhattan, and they serve healthful food and drinks. The prices are really very reasonable for Manhattan and the portions are great for those reasonable prices. And the taste of the food was great. The eggs, baguette toast, and potatoes were just perfect. The eggs were done well with some milk and perfectly salted and not salty, the potatoes were almost like Yukon Gold tasting even if they weren’t, and they were flavored with just the right seasoning including rosemary, and the baguette was soft and chewy inside and crispy on the outside. The smoothie was a large portion, the salad was so healthful with kale and almonds and sweet potato w a balsamic vinegar sauce, and the chicken wings were lightly battered and crispy on a bed of arugula. Just the right portions and had some leftovers. Try this place! Enjoy the quaint feel and decorations also.

originalText.text: Been here for breakfast twice, and it was really quiet both times, the first time I was the only person in there. It’s a really lovely cafe, the food was amazing, I really recommend the pancakes, and the smoothies were huge and delicious. Loved coming here and would love to come back here some time.

originalText.text: We were seated outside it was nice. The food was good but I like it better at Effy’s Cafe. It was fresher
